intro: Dugortia, commonly known as the golden saxifrage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring.
